snippet: An appeals court on Wednesday struck down a voter-approved law that denies bail to immigrants who are in the country illegally and have been charged with a range of felonies, including shoplifting, aggravated identity theft, sexual assault and...
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit strikes down a voter-approved Arizona law that denies bail to immigrants who are in the country illegally and have been charged with a range of felonies; 11-member panel rules that law violates due-process right by imposing punishment before trial.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court on Wednesday struck down a voter-approved law that denies bail to immigrants who are in the country illegally and have been charged with a range of felonies, including shoplifting, aggravated identity theft, sexual assault and murder.

headline.main: Arizona: Court Rejects Law Denying Bail to Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Court Rejects Law Denying Bail to Immigrants
